titleStmt.title: Letters [ca. summer of 244 BC]
titleStmt.author: Apollonios, secretary of Eukles, 14 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 293

msContents.summary: Drafts of letters to Eukles by Apollonios, his chief secretary; the main subject is the rebates granted to farmers upon the rent of the land formerly held by Apollonios the dioiketes; after surveying the situation, the secretary requests that someone, and possibly Eukles himself, be sent to settle the accounts with the farmers; Apollonios also refers to some Syrian workers

msItemStruct.note: 26 lines written across the fibers; on the other side there is P.Col. IV 88
The hand is small and proficient, but the text shows lots of minute interlinear corrections and additions, since it is a draft

supportDesc.support: 1papyrus fragment, broken at bottom ; 12 x 30 cm

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 11 (original no. 9) in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Many people mentioned, -- see Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, sec. IX
